p: Qualitative variables were reported as frequencies and percentages. All analyses were processed with the IBM Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS) software version 21.0 (SPSS, Chicago, IL, USA). One-way ANOVA followed by the Tukey test were performed for comparison between groups. The frequency distributions of clinical symptoms were analyzed using a paired sample t-Test, and the Pearson correlations were performed in a pairwise manner. A p-value <0.05 was considered statistically significant.
